title: Iron Springs, Arizona
text:
Iron Springs (also Ironsprings) is an <a href="Unincorporated%20area">unincorporated community</a> in central <a href="Yavapai%20County%2C%20Arizona">Yavapai County</a>, <a href="Arizona">Arizona</a>, United States, in the <a href="Prescott%20National%20Forest">Prescott National Forest</a>. It lies along Iron Springs Road northwest of the city of <a href="Prescott%2C%20Arizona">Prescott</a>, the <a href="county%20seat">county seat</a> of Yavapai County. Its elevation is 6,073 feet (1,851 m). Although Iron Springs is unincorporated, it has a <a href="post%20office">post office</a>, with the <a href="ZIP%20code">ZIP code</a> of 86330.
Originally summer homes, it continues to this day as a year round retreat.
Climate.
According to the <a href="K%C3%B6ppen%20Climate%20Classification">Köppen Climate Classification</a> system, Iron Springs has a <a href="semi-arid%20climate">semi-arid climate</a>, abbreviated "BSk" on climate maps.
